summary.narrativeincludeclinical:
Initial information received on 22 May 2006 via consumer's attorney in form of a civil complaint (case # 06 CV 3816). Attorney alleged consumer (plaintiff) had received injections of Aredia (pamidronate) and Zometa (zoledronate) for an unknown indication and duration and developed osteonecrosis of the jaw. Additionally he received Fosamax (alendronate). As a result of administration of these drugs he suffered severe physical and medical injuries and associated disabilities, severe pain and suffering, and severe mental anguish, and the loss of enjoyment of life.
17 Mar 2008 follow up compiled from several medical professionals' records via the Legal Department: This patient had an extensive dental history (gum tissue described as very poor, deep pockets, concern for bone loss on maxillary arch especially the anterior teeth, lower lingual inflammation, heavy radiation with complaint of sensitivity of gums, dry tongue, and deep decay) and he was treated with Aredia and Zometa (no other regimen details specified). On 02 Sep 1999 a dental note reported a marked increase in caries over past six months (no dates specified) and the tissue was extremely red and sore due to excessive oral dryness (no other details specified). The Primary Care physician noted on 13 Apr 2000 that the patient was on pamidronate every three months. It was also noted that the patient was diagnosed (date not specified) with avascular necrosis of left hip and shoulder (no other details specified) and sicca syndrome with dry eyes (no other details specified). A report from a dentist in June 2000 stated that this patient had dry mouth with gums easily bleeding (no other details specified). On 15 Jan 2001 the patient was seen by the Primary Care physician because of left hip pain. It was noted that the patient also had osteonecrosis of hip secondary to long term steroid treatment. On 26 Mar 2002 the Primary Care physician saw the patient for a general physical. It was noted that the patient had had a left hip replacement in April 2001 due to osteonecrosis secondary to long term steriod use (no other details specified). The patient was also noted to have chronic restriction of motion of his left shoulder along with both ankles which limits daily activity (no other details specified). It was reported on 27 Feb 2003 by the Primary Care physician that the patient had numerous episodes of vertigo and had fallen in snow and hit his head (date not specified). The patient underwent a computed tomography scan which was within normal limits (no other information specified). On 10 Dec 2003 the Primary Care physician noted that the patient had chronic mild elevation of LFTs (liver function tests) (no other details noted). A 29 Oct 2004 a periodontist examaination revealed that the patient had receding gums, dry mouth, and oral hygiene fair to poor. The diagnosis given was chronic periodontitis, caries, and dry mouth. The treatment plan was surgical therapy for crown lengthening, home care, scale and root plane all teeth. As planned the patient underwent oral surgery on the manible and maxilla on 27 Jan 2005 (no other details specified). On 11 Apr 2005 a dental note stated that there was an ulceration of #27 gingival margin-facial. A pathology report showed mandibular gingiva-chronic inflammation. A 21 Apr 2005 a dental note recorded that the patient was healing well and the debridement and ulceration had healed (no other details specified). On 31 Aug 2005 a Primary Care note stated that the patient was still on Zometa and continued to have dry cough (no other details specified). On 23 Mar 2006 the dentist noted that the patient was seen as an emergency, was not treated with any medication at that time, and was observed with bone slough and large sequestrum. On an unspecified date the sequestrum was removed (no other details specified). On 24 Mar 2006 the dentist noted that the patient was seen for evaluation of right maxillary posterior dentition. The patient reported to the dentist that he had some exposed bone removed from the right posterior quadrant in the region of tooth #2 and was asymptomatic. The dentist stated that, "I am concerned that the patient has been on Zometa for many years which compromises the vascular supply to the maxilla and mandible". The dentist noted that the patient may have osteroradionecrosis possibly generated from the dying pulp of tooth 2 (no more details were provided). Upon examination by the dentist it was noted that patient was significant for relative limited opening of the mandible, a significant intrabony defect was noted in between the roots of tooth 2 and 3 on the palatal aspect of these teeth, and there was at least a 10 mm pocket involving both roots. On an unspecified date a panoramic xray showed an intraosseous lesion between teeth 2 and 3. The lesion was observed to extend to the apices of tooth 2 and within 3 mm of the apex of tooth 3. It was recommended that the patient discontinue Zometa and start Z Pak (azithromycin) and doxycycline. On 05 Apr 2006 the dentist noted that the patient underwent surgical extraction of tooth 2, a full thickness flap was elevated from #s 12-15 and 18-24, all granulation tissue was removed, and the roots thoroughly planed. It was reported that there were no unusual complications in the post-operative period (no other details specified). On 08 Dec 2006 the Primary Care physician reported that the patient bumped his right leg "several days ago" and the scab was not healing. The asssessment was erythematous pretibial cellulitis with solitary eschar and the treatment was Augmentin (amoxicillin and clavulunate potassium) (no other details specified). On 08 Feb 2007 the patient was seen with a foot ulcer on left which started "six weeks prior". The associated sign was redness and he was prescribed Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim) for 14 days (no other details specified). On 16 Feb 2007 the patient underwent a whole body scan. The findings were compatible with focal osteomyelitis of left mid tibia, a left rib focal lesion worrisome for a bone neoplasm, and degenerative changes in lumbosacral spine, right hip, and both shoulders (no other detaisl specified). On 08 Mar 2007 the patient was admitted to the hospital for a planned bone biopsy over area of circular wound over the tibial ridge (no other details specified). On 13 Mar 2007 a computed tomography scan of chest showed there is evidence of chronic lung disease with right upper lobe consolidative change noted but there was no evidence of rib lesion (no other details specified).
Upon internal review on 03 Apr 2009 of information received on 17 Mar 2008, the case was amended to reflect the dentist as the primary reporter.
Follow-up information recieved on 29 Mar 2010, via the consumer's attorney, inclusive of medical records. The patient's concomitant medications were updated. The patient's medical history was updated with leukemia. The patient underwent evacuation of subdural hematoma on 29 Oct 2009.
Follow up received on 19 May 2010 via the consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. On 13 Nov 2007, the patient was experiencing recurrent epistaxis and presented for cautery. Records dated 27 Nov 2007 noted he was doing well.
Follow-up report received from the consumer's attorney on 21 Jun 2010 inclusive of medical records: Barium enemas, performed on 24 Feb 2001 and 21 Sep 2005 noted diverticulosis of the sigmoid colon.
Followup information received on 28 Jun 2010 and 29 Jun 2010 from the consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records: Aredia therapy was noted on 24 Jan 2000, 08 Jun 2000, 12 Oct 2000, 18 Jan 2001, 17 Oct 2001, 17 Oct 2002 and Zometa therapy was noted on 18 Mar 2003, 03 Nov 2003 (exact start/end dates were not provided). Record dated 27 Jan 2005 noted a full thickness flap and distal wedge was elevated from tooth #2-8, all granulation tissue was removed, and osseous recontouring was performed to increase the crown height on the quadrant. Record dated 24 Mar 2006 noted the patient was experiencing graft versus host disease and that Zometa injections were received four times per year. Record dated 10 Jun 2009 noted that the patient was off Zometa (end date unspecified). Record dated 31 Jul 2009 noted tooth #14,15 has fractured. Record dated 27 Aug 2009 noted tooth #3, 14 and 15 were extracted. Radiology report dated 26 Oct 2009 noted mild reverse curvature of the spine and paresthesia.
Combined follow up information received from the consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records on 20 Jul 2010 and 30 Jul 2010: Records dated 03 Jan 2007 revealed wound in the leg which happened when he struck a furniture or cabinet. Bone scan was advised on 31 Jan 2007. Bone scan on 16 Feb 2007 noted positive for osteomyelitis. Records dated 01 Mar 2007 noted peripheral scleroderma with some very tight skin, with a scab at the anterior aspect of his tibia which healed very poorly, poor ankle motion, hearing loss, swallowing difficulty and suspected osteomyelitis. Patient's medical history included AML (leukemia) with bone marrow transplant in 1995, penicillin allergy, cataracts, total hip replacement in 2001, GVHD and a torn achilles tendon in 1991. The patient had received therapy with cellcept, prednisolone and other anti-rejection medications until 2000. The patient developed scleroderma as a result of therapy several years before. Patient was receiving treatment with Tri-cor, Zyvox, Amoxicillin and Vancomycin. Physical examination noted approximately two to three centimetre open area over the crest of the tibia. There were dermatic changes of the soft tissue consistent with scleroderma, thickening and decreased pliability and 2+ dorsalis pedes pulse and exposed bone in the depth of the wound. MRI performed on 06 Mar 2007 revealed oedema in the left and right tibialis posterior muscle, lesion in medullary cavity of the mid tibia and small area of oedema in left tibia and suggested
Follow up received on 31 Dec 2010 from the consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records: Medical records dated 20 Oct 2009 indicated the patient developed a seizure managed with keppra and dilantin. On 06 Nov 2009, the medical records also indicated the patient had mild nystagmus. On 09 Nov 2009, patient had pneumonia and chest x-ray result revealed ill-defined hazy density in the upper lobe with associated pleural thickening and retraction of the hila regions with tracheal deviation to the right.
Follow up received on 31Jan 2011 from the consumers attorney inclusive of medical records: Medical records dated 22 Feb 1995 indicated the patient had Hickman site infected, neutropenia and tinnitus in quiet situations. The consumer's medical records also inclusive of updates of medical historyand concomitant medication.
Follow up reveived on 24 Mar 2011 from the consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records: Records dated on 02 Nov 2009 stated that the patient had post operative seizures with eyes rolling back in head and chin twitching and also had dysarthria. Records dated on 22 Jan 2010 stated that patient had no additional seizures and improving well and his left sided craniotomy incision was well healed.
Follow up received on 10 May 2011 from the consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records: Medical records dated 15 Feb 2011 indicated the patient had macular edema of both eyes, blepharitis, corneal scar left eye and punctal cautery done for both eyes. The consumer's medical records also inclusive of updates of medical history.
Follow-up received on 09 May 2012 via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. Records dated 12 Dec 2011 stated that the patient had shortness of breath and small bilateral pleural effusion. The outcome of the event was not reported.
Follow-up received on 22 May 2012 via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. Records dated 12 Dec 2011 stated that the patient had hypotension, lactic acidosis, respiratory distress and sinus tachycardia. On 13 Dec 2011 the patient suffered death due to toxic shock syndrome. The records further stated that the patient also had septic shock, leukocytosis with bandemia and abdominal distension. The outcome of the events was not reported.
Follow-up received on 23 Jul 2012, via consumer's attorney inclusive of the medical records. CT of chest performed on unspecified date revealed bi-apical infiltrates. Record dated 12 Dec 2011 stated that patient had fatigue, low back pain, several episodes of small amount of loose stool, chills, nausea, clinical dehydration, metabolic acidosis, sclerotic deformity of the humeral head, sore throat, colitis and mild dyspnea on exertion. For sore throat patient took Amoxicillin. Record dated 13 Dec 2011 stated that patient had discomfort to the left posterior back and chest area, abdominal pain, cardiac arrest and elevation of lactate level. Outcome of the events was not reported.
Combined follow up received on 17 Oct 2012 and 18 Oct 2012 from physician via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records respectively. Patient's family history included melanoma and non-melanoma skin cancer. Record dated 20 Jul 2010 noted decay on the distal surface of # 6. Record dated 14 Aug 2010 noted atypical mole melanoma. Record dated 17 Aug 2010 noted calcinosis cutis. Record dated 12 Dec 2010 noted that patient was suffering from skin cancer and nodules on the abdomen and legs in mid-2010. Record dated 28 Oct 2011 noted irritated seborrheic keratosis and subconjunctival hemorrhage. The outcome of the events was not reported.
Follow-up received on 19 Oct 2012 from consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. Record dated 13 Nov 2007 stated that the patient had bronchitis. The outcome of the event was not reported.
Combined follow-up received on 07 Dec 2012 and 10 Dec 2012 via consumer's attorney inclusive of medical records. Record dated 12 Jul 2002 stated that patient had rectal polyp. Record dated 12 Sep 2002 stated that patient had osteopenia. Record dated 20 Jul 2004 stated that patient had lichenoid changes, disfigured and irregular oral mucosa. Record dated 19 Oct 2004 stated that patient had chronic right lower lobe crackles. Record dated 26 Oct 2005 stated that patient had sclerotic changes mainly involving his both ankles. Record dated 30 Jul 2008 that patient had 3+ meibomian gland dysfunction of the upper and lower eyelids in both eyes, subepithelial fibrosis and left conjunctiva +1 diffuse hyperemia. Record dated 25 Aug 2008 stated that patient had hypercalcemia, dermatitis, abscess unspecified site and ben hyperplas prostate Record dated 21 Feb 2009 stated that patient had anemia and hemorrhage nos. Record dated 27 Oct 2009 stated that patient underwent removal of squamous cell carcinoma of a scalp lesion. Record dated 27 May 2011 stated that patient had ororpharynx erythema. Record dated 06 Jun 2011 stated that patient had shotty lymphadenopathy. Record dated 08 Jun 2011 stated that patient had degenerative change in spine and coronary arterial calcification. Record dated 28 Oct 2011 stated that patient had acute conjunctivitis. Record dated 06 Dec 2011 stated that patient had iritis and trichiasis. Record dated 13 Dec 2011 stated that patient had acute renal failure. Outcome of the events was not reported.
summary.sendercomment:
MAC: Review of available data reported in this legal case does not allow for proper causality assessments. Treatment dates with Zometa and Aredia are not reported. Some conditions found in the report may not have developed under treatment with the products. The patient's events may be attributable to the underlying malignancy.
Due to Argus restriction following event could not be coded in event screen: Dry cough [NS, Cough, Aredia: NS, UL, UL, Zometa: NS, L, L, L].
